trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The ling has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the ling's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Adrenal Frenzy
entries: The ling may make an additional claw attack as part of its attack action against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Aggressive (Raptorling)
entries: As a bonus action, the ling can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Claw (Raptorling)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) damage.

variant.name: Raptorling
entries: An evolution of the Swarmling causes it to develop multiple sets of insectoid wings, allowing them to jump their maximum distance without a running start, and increasing the maximum long jump and high jump distance to half its speed. Additionally, the ling gains the Aggressive trait due to related evolutionary pathways opened by the mutation. Finally, the ling's damage die becomes a {@dice d6} as a result of its chemically-induced aggression. A Raptorling is CR 1.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the ling dies, it bursts in a splash of acid, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The acid deals maximum damage to objects made of organic materials that are not being worn or carried.

trait.name: Standing Leap (Hunter Strain)
entries: The ling's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Baneful Nibble
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) acid damage.

variant.name: Hunter Strain
entries: A guided, forced evolution of generations of Banelings led to a faster, more agile and more aggressive Hunter Strain. Hunter Strain Banelings gain a walking and climbing speed of 40 feet, and the Standing Leap feature. Their CR is unchanged.

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The corruptor ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has {@condition charmed}. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

action.name: Parasite Spores
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 6d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Caustic Spray
entries: The corruptor targets a creature within 60 feet of itself, launching a stream of acid at it. That creature and creatures within 5 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage, and for 1 minute when the target
takes damage it takes an additional {@damage 1d8} acid damage (this doesn't stack with additional uses of caustic spray). On a success the target takes half damage, and suffers no other effects.

action.name: Corruption
entries: One beast or humanoid the corruptor can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the corruptor's telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this corruptor's corruption for the next 24 hours.
The corruptor can have only one target {@condition charmed} at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The lisk has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Poison Strikes
entries: If the lisk hits a creature with either its needle spines or its claws, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, a creature can make a Constitution saving throw, ending the effects on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the lisk's Poison Strikes for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lisk makes two needle spines attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Needle Spines
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/200 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) damage.

trait.name: Rapid Regeneration
entries: The lisk regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and has not been damaged since the end of its last turn.

action.name: Glave Wurm
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

When the glaive wurm hits a creature, it can bounce to another creature within 10 feet of the initial target, and then again to another creature within 10 feet of the second target. A separate attack roll is made for each target. If there are multiple creatures that the glaive
wurm could bounce to, the lisk chooses which target the glaive wurm bounces to.

spellcasting.name: Psionic Spellcasting
headerEntries: The queen utilizes a combination of arcane, innate and biological abilities to perform the equivalents of the following spells. When casting spells with this feature, the queen does not need to perform verbal components or provide material components.

trait.name: Spawn Tumor
entries: The queen can spend 1 hour creating a creep tumor on a surface within 5 feet of it. It is {@condition incapacitated} while doing so. After a queen has used this trait, it can't do so again for 1 week.

trait.name: Tend Eggs
entries: By spending 2 hours tending to an egg, the queen doubles the rate of growth of that egg for 1 day. An egg can't be affected by this trait more than once a day.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The queen makes two spine attacks.

action.name: Spines
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) damage.

legendary.name: Spellcasting
entries: The queen casts one of her available spells.

legendary.name: Transfuse
entries: The queen uses Transfuse. She cannot make attacks of any sort until the end of her next turn. Additionally, if Transfuse was on cooldown, it only heals half of the rolled hit points and nothing more.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The roach regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and has not been damaged since the end of its last turn.

action.name: Acidic Saliva
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) piercing damage. Cannot target units directly above the roach, as the roach cannot look up.

action.name: Scything Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d10 + 1}) slashing damage.

Vile strain roaches are a product of the toxic microbes that live in the water they drink. While a roaches immune system is strong enough to protect itself against the microbes on, the immune system of the creatures it feeds on often aren't. The microbes live in the roaches saliva, and when roach spits on a creature, the microbes come with, quickly securing themselves in the wounds left by the acid and infecting them. A vile strain roach has a challenge rating of 4 (1,100 XP) and the following trait.

entries.name: Toxic Saliva
entries: When the roach hits a creature with its acidic saliva, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or be affected as though the Slow spell had been cast on it. Instead of making a Wisdom saving throw on subsequent turns to end the effect, the target makes a Constitution saving throw. If the effect ends, the target is immune to Toxic Saliva for the next 24 hours.

Ravagers are easily recognized by the large gaping hole in the center of their shell. The hole is filled with superheated plasma that the ravager can eject as a deadly stream, arcing it though the air and onto its enemies. It's capable of using this plasma in subtler ways as well, and can its plasma as small, compact balls against its enemies. A ravager's acidic saliva deals fire damage instead of acid damage, has a challenge rating of 4 (1,100 XP) and the following action.

entries.name: Corrosive Bile
entries: The Ravager launches a pile of burning liquid from the top of its carapace, landing in a 10 foot square at a location it can see within 150 feet. Creatures in the square must a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage. On a success the target takes half damage.

spellcasting.name: Psionic Spellcasting
headerEntries: The infestor utilizes a combination of arcane, innate and pathological abilities to perform the equivalents of the following spells. When casting spells with this feature, the infestor does not need to perform verbal components or provide material components. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks)

1e: {@spell crown of madness} (target has disadvantage on save)

action.name: Consume
entries: The infestor immediately kills one willing living creature. The defiler regains 3 uses of a 3/day each spell, or 1 use of a 1/day each spell. This action cannot be used on a creature {@condition charmed} by it.

action.name: Microbial Shroud (one use of a per-day spell)
entries: The infestor targets a point that it can see within 60 feet of itself, creating a 15 foot radius orange opaque cloud centered at that point for 1 minute. Creatures of the infestor's choice within the cloud have resistance to damage from ranged attacks. If a creature already has resistance to at least one damage type of an attack, the attack must be made with disadvantage.

action.name: Fungal Growth {@recharge}
entries: The infestor launches a mass of liquified green fungus at a point within 60 feet of it that splashes out and affects all creatures in a 20 foot radius. Each creature must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure the target is {@condition grappled} and takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage at the start of their turns for 1 minute. On a success the target has their movement speed halved for their next turn, and suffers no other effects. As an action, a target can make a Strength check, ending all effects on a success.

trait.name: Power Overwhelming
entries: An archon has devastating abilities, but this power comes at a cost. The sacrifice of the templars required to create an archon cannot be undone - they are transfigured into this being of pure energy for the remainder of their lives. Furthermore, the archon loses 7 ({@damage 1d12}) hit points at the end of each of its turns if it has used any action; this cannot be prevented in any way.
In return, the archon receives the following benefits:

entries.name: Psionic Shield
entries: The archon gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns; while these temporary hit points last, the archon is immune to force damage.

entries.name: Elemental Body
entries: Any creature that touches the archon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it suffers {@damage 1d8} lightning damage, increased to {@dice 1d10} if it is touched with a weapon made of metal.

entries.name: Call of the Void
entries: Upon being reduced to 0 hit points, the archon uses the remnants of its energy to create a vacuum which pulls in nearby enemies. All creatures within 5 ft. of it must make a {@dc 15} Strength save, taking {@damage 8d8} force damage on a failure or half as much on a success, as their body is stretched and torn. Afterwards, the archon quietly and immediately disappears, leaving behind a glowing, red-hot circle of glyphs on the closest surface.

trait.name: Psionic Mass
entries: The archon may hover and move along vertical surfaces and ceilings, but it cannot fly any further than 10 feet away from a solid surface.

trait.name: Telepathic Bond (Dark Archon only)
entries: The archon ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has {@condition charmed}. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archon makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Nerve-Wracking Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and 5 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic. A creature hit by this attack cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Psionic Shockwave {@recharge}
entries: A focused blast of psionic energy is torn from the archon and released in a manner of its choosing. All creatures in the affected area must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} lightning damage. The archon may choose one of the following two effects:

items: The archon releases the blast in a controlled beam, strafing a 60 ft. long, 5 ft. wide line on a surface, starting from any point within 60 feet that the archon can see.
The archon releases the blast as a violent pulse stemming from a single point on a surface within 90 feet that the archon can see, covering a 15 ft. circle.

entries: A dark archon is formed by the unity of two Nerazim dark templars. Dark archons are even more chaotic and volatile than Khalai archons; they are not capable of directly striking their enemies, but can support fellow Nerazim warriors with powerful psionic, mind-affecting abilities. Less resilient and more voracious than Khalai archons, they resolve to draining energy from fallen enemies and allies alike to maintain their form. A Dark Archon is Large, does not add its Constitution modifier to its hit points, loses its Psionic Shield feature and its Psionic Shockwave and Nerve-Wracking Slam, and gains the following features:

entries.name: Psionic Maelstrom (Recharge 5-6)
entries: As an action on its turn, the dark archon chooses a location it can see within 60 feet, crashing waves of psionic energy into a 15 ft. radius sphere. Non-Nerazim creatures of its choice within this area must succeed a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to take bonus action and reactions and have their movement speed reduced to 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Psychic Assault (2/day)
entries: As an action, the dark archon assaults the mind of a creature it can see within 60 feet, attempting to crush its personality and take over. The creature must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the archon for 1 hour, or until the archon loses concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. Undead and uninhabited constructs have disadvantage on this saving throw. The archon can give telepathic commands to the {@condition charmed} target (no action required on its turn), which the target must obey.
If the target receives a suicidal command, takes any damage or is affected by the archon's abilities, they may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Siphon Energy
entries: Whenever a creature that is not undead or an uninhabited construct which the dark archon can see within 30 feet falls to 0 hit points, the archon can use its reaction to regain a number of hit points equal to 7 ({@damage 1d12}) plus the number of hit dice of the creature. Alternatively, the archon can regain an expended use of Psychic Assault.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ultralisk deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Cleave
entries: When the ultralisk hits a creature with its Kaiser Blades, any creature who would be hit by the same attack roll within 5 ft. of the target takes half the attack's damage.

trait.name: Frenzied
entries: When the ultralisk drops below 160 hit points, it breaks free of any {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition stunned} conditions currently affecting it, and becomes immune to these conditions and psychic damage. This immunity lasts until it drops to 0 hit points or its current hit points rise above 160 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ultralisk makes three melee attacks: two with its Kaiser Blades and one with its Gore. It can replace the Gore attack with a Stomp if available.

action.name: Kaiser Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) slashing damage. Cannot be used against {@condition prone} targets.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}39 ({@damage 5d12 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is also {@condition restrained}. If the ultralisk moves or uses another Stomp attack, the grapple ends.

legendary.name: Charge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ultralisk moves up to half its speed, provoking opportunity attacks. It then makes one Gore attack; a creature hit by this attack must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength save or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Thunderous Roar
entries: The ultralisk bellows in rage. Any creature within 30 feet of the ultralisk must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 3d8}) thunder damage and be {@condition deafened} until the end of the ultralisk's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not {@condition deafened}.

legendary.name: Furious Cleave (Only available while Frenzied)
entries: The ultralisk rears back and cleaves all creatures within a 20 ft. cone, making a Kaiser Blades attack against all of them. Every attack that hits deals half damage.

spellcasting.name: Psionic Spellcasting
headerEntries: The high templar's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The high templar can innately cast the following spells, requiring only somatic components:
will: {@spell levitate} (willing, non-charmed humanoids or objects only)

action.name: Feedback
entries: The high templar psionically pulls the arcane or divine energy of a spellcaster forth, forcing it into a destructive feedback loop. One creature within 120 feet which the high templar can see must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, they lose 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) levels' worth of spell slots of the target's choice, and they take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) per levels' worth of spell slots lost.

trait.name: Blind Zeal
entries: The zealot's faith is strong and unshakeable, but also its greatest weakness. While connected to the Khala, the zealot gains an additional 15 feet of walking speed every turn, which it can only expend to move in the direction of an enemy.

If its connection to the Khala is broken, the zealot will be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Its attacks are at disadvantage and cannot benefit from advantage, until its connection is returned (or it becomes a Nerazim). Additionally, it loses its resistance to psychic damage, on top of the regular effects of losing the light of the Khala.

Losing this connection can be achieved by an antimagic field, an effect that prevents planar travel or having all its nerve cords severed or shortened, which can be done by effects that sever silver cords or through a called attack made with a slashing weapon and a -5 penalty to hit. The cords have 15 hit points.

trait.name: Plasma Shields
entries: The zealot is protected by a solid, transparent shield. The shield grants the zealot 20 temporary hit points which recharge after a short rest; while these temporary hit points remain, the zealot has an increased AC of 18 instead of 16.

trait.name: Psionic Charge
entries: If the zealot moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zealot makes two attacks with its psi blades.

action.name: Psi Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) radiant damage.

Akhundelar, meaning "tip of the spear", are zealots who have accepted the certainty of death and volunteered to lead a foray into enemy territory. The strength of their charge is legendary, but even though they may be hundreds of years old, they are still only zealots, willing to die to give their brothers a chance at victory. An Akhundelar has a {@dice d12} hit die (average 68 HP) and a challenge rating of 5 (1,800 XP), and their Psionic Charge is replaced with the following feature.

entries.name: Lightning Charge
entries: If the zealot moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage. Additionally, once per short rest, the zealot may force all non-Firstborn creatures within a 10-foot radius to make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw after the charge, taking {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failure and being pushed to any unoccupied space outside of the radius. Creatures that succeed the saving throw take half damage and are not pushed.

The backbone of the Nerazim Shadow Guard, Centurions are versatile and agile zealots, occupying an unusual close-support role. Centurions have the Darkcoil ability, and their Psionic Charge is replaced by Shadow Charge.

entries.name: Shadow Charge
entries: The centurion can take the Disengage action as a bonus action, and is {@condition invisible} on its turn while moving straight towards an enemy.

entries.name: Darkcoil (Recharge 6)
entries: The centurion can replace one of its attacks with a coil of astral energy. The centurion can choose any number of creatures to resist this effect; any other non-Nerazim creatures within a 10-foot radius must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, becoming {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn on a failure or having their movement speed halved for the same duration on a success.

trait.name: Void Shields
entries: The templar is protected by a solid energy shield which warps light around it. The shield grants the templar 40 temporary hit points which recharge after a short rest; while these temporary hit points remain, the templar has resistance to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the templar can become {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the templar wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it. If the templar loses its Void Shields, it also loses this feature.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The templar deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the templar that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the templar doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The templar makes two attacks with its warp blades.

action.name: Warp Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The templar turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the templar wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

The Zer'atai are a clan of Nerazim warriors famed for their great hunts, clad in armors made of the bones and exoskeletons of their kills (primarily Swarm). Their warp blades are almost always in the form of double-bladed scythes, which they use to perform multiple attacks against groups of enemies within range. Zer'atai have a challenge rating of 6, a hit die of {@dice d10} and gain the following action:

entries.name: Shadow Fury (Recharge 6)
entries: The templar selects up to five creatures within 30 feet of it, quickly moving to each without provoking opportunity attacks or requiring a surface to walk on, and striking them with its warp blades. Each target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution save or suffer 21 ({@damage 6d6}) force damage. The templar then returns to its starting position.

Assassins of the Lenassa clan, wearing full cloth covering to further conceal their identities and wielding a single curved, purple warp blade. Lenassa have a challenge rating of 6, a hit die of {@dice d10} and gain the following features:

entries.name: Shadow Stride
entries: While {@condition invisible} or in dim light or darkness, the templar can use a bonus action to teleport to another area in dim light or darkness within 30 feet that it can see, or anywhere within 30 feet if it is {@condition invisible}.

entries.name: Shadow Cleave
entries: When the templar hits with a melee weapon attack against an enemy that is not within 5 feet of another enemy, if the templar is in dim light or darkness or is {@condition invisible}, the target receives an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

monster.name: Sightseer
senses: darkvision 120 ft. (penetrates magical darkness, blind after this range)
languages: understands one language its creator knows but can't speak

trait.name: Eerie Buoyancy
entries: Whenever the sightseer takes force, bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, it may move 10 feet directly away from the source of the damage, without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: False Cornea
entries: If the sightseer falls below half its maximum hit points or takes at least 20 damage at once from any single source, its frontal plate falls off, revealing an open mouth with rows of needle-like teeth. It loses its darkvision and beam attack, gaining a bite attack and the ability to move half its movement speed towards an enemy as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sightseer makes two attacks.

action.name: Ocular Beam (before False Cornea)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Eyebite (after False Cornea)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage.

trait.name: Rage (4/Day)
entries: On his turn, Komodai can enter a rage as a bonus action. The rage lasts 1 minute, until ended as a bonus action, or until he is knocked {@condition unconscious} or if his turn ends and he hasn't attacked a creature or taken damage since his last turn.
While raging, Komodai gains the following benefits:
- Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
- A +3 bonus to the damage roll of melee weapon attacks using Strength.
- Resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
- Extra damage on the first weapon attack that hits on his turn equal to {@damage 1d6 + 5} radiant damage.

trait.name: Warrior of Tiamat
entries: If a spell, such as Raise Dead, has the sole effect of restoring Komodai to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on him.
Komodai is also carrying Queen's Wrath, a magical +1 Greataxe that deals an additional {@damage 1d6} acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage, of the attuned wielder's choice.

trait.name: Fanatical Resistance (1/Rage)
entries: If Komodai fails a saving throw while raging, he can reroll it.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: Komodai has advantage on initiative rolls and Dexterity saving throws against effects he can see.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of his turn, Komodai can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Queen's Wrath
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage.

action.name: Queen's Wrath (Rage)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 8}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage.

action.name: Queen's Wrath (Divine Fury)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 8}) slashing damage, plus 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage.

bonus.name: Zealous Presence (2/Short Rest)
entries: Komodai unleashes a battle cry infused with divine energy. Up to ten other creatures of his choice within 60 feet of him that can hear him gain advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Blind Zeal
entries: The Executor's faith is strong and unshakeable, but also its greatest weakness. While connected to the Khala, the Executor gains an additional 15 feet of walking speed every turn, which it can only expend to move in the direction of an enemy.

If its connection to the Khala is broken, the Executor will be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Its attacks are at disadvantage and cannot benefit from advantage, until its connection is returned (or it becomes a Nerazim). Additionally, it loses its resistance to psychic damage, on top of the regular effects of losing the light of the Khala.

Losing this connection can be achieved by an antimagic field, an effect that prevents planar travel or having all its nerve cords severed or shortened, which can be done by effects that sever silver cords or through an attack that deals fire, force, radiant or slashing damage. The cords have 20 hit points, and the Executor's AC plus 5.

trait.name: Plasma Shields
entries: The Executor is protected by a solid, transparent shield. The shield grants the Executor 40 temporary hit points which recharge after a short rest; while these temporary hit points remain, the Executor has an increased AC of 19 instead of 17.

trait.name: Lightning Charge (2/Short Rest)
entries: If the Executor moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage. Additionally, twice per short rest, the executor may force all non-Firstborn creatures within a 10-foot radius to make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw after the charge, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failure and being pushed to any unoccupied space outside of the radius. Creatures that succeed the saving throw take half damage and are not pushed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Executor makes two attacks with its psi blades.

action.name: Psi Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Astral Wind (1/Day)
entries: The Executor heals for {@dice 5d12} hit points, and restores half of maximum shields to all creatures of its choice within 30 feet which have shields.

trait.name: Plasma Shields
entries: The adept is protected by a solid, transparent shield. The shield grants the adept 20 temporary hit points which recharge after a short rest; while these temporary hit points remain, the adept has an increased AC of 16 instead of 14.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adept makes two attacks with its glaives.

action.name: Resonating Glaive
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) radiant damage. If the target is wearing light or no armor, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the adept has advantage on glaive attacks against the target for 1 minute.

bonus.name: Psionic Transfer {@recharge 5}
entries: The adept releases an incorporeal, psionic projection of itself, which can freely move into and out of the space of other creatures (but not through objects). As a free action on its turn, the adept may move this projection up to 45 ft. in any direction, as long as it is along a surface. As a bonus action on subsequent turns, or after a minute, the adept can shift into the psionic projection, regardless of distance. The projection disappears, and the adept teleports to its position. The adept's glaives deal an additional {@damage 2d6} psychic damage to creatures the psionic projection moved through since the beginning of its last turn.
The adept can only roll to recharge this ability at the start of its turn if the projection is not active.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The viper makes two Acid Spore attacks, and uses its Abduct if it is available.

action.name: Acid Spore
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) acid damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 5d12 + 3}) piercing damage. Has advantage if used against a creature the viper is grappling, and disadvantage otherwise if the target is not in the air. If used against a creature that the viper used its Abduct on, the creature is dropped to the ground after the attack.

action.name: Abduct {@recharge 5}
entries: The viper targets one creature of size Large or smaller within 90 ft. of itself. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 90 feet straight towards the viper and be {@condition grappled}. If the creature is willing, the viper can instead immediately drop the creature up to 60 feet below it, preventing the creature from suffering fall damage.

action.name: Parasitic Bomb {@recharge 6}
entries: The viper spits a spore charged with rapidly growing parasites at a creature it can see within 120 feet. The target must succeed a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage and be affected by the parasites for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and the effect ends. A target currently in the air has disadvantage on this saving throw.

An affected target takes 3 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns, and non-Swarm creatures take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage if they end their turn within 15 ft. of the target or start their turn in that area for the first time.

trait.name: Towering
entries: The hulk can step over and into the space of any other creatures that are Large or smaller. It may choose to provide half-cover to creatures it shares a space with.
The hulk requires an area to be at least 20 feet high to move without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hulk makes three melee attacks, one of which can be an Impale.

action.name: Impale
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}. The hulk can only have two creatures {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.
This attack has advantage on creatures the hulk shares a space with, and the hulk can use this attack as an Attack of Opportunity against creatures attempting to exit said space.

action.name: Pustulant Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage.

monster.name: Rezmir

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Rezmir has the {@item Black Dragon Mask|hotdq}, {@item Hazirawn|hotdq}, and an {@item insignia of claws|hotdq}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Rezmir can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Dark Advantage
entries: Once per turn, Rezmir can deal an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage when she hits with a weapon attack, provided Rezmir has advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Draconic Majesty
entries: While wearing no armor and wearing the Black Dragon Mask, Rezmir adds her Charisma bonus to her AC (included).

trait.name: Immolation
entries: When Rezmir is reduced to 0 hit points, her body disintegrates into a pile of ash.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Rezmir fails a saving throw while wearing the Black Dragon Mask, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Greatsword (Hazirawn)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points for 1 minute. The target can make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this effect early on a success.

action.name: Caustic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Rezmir breathes acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendaryHeader: If she is wearing the Black Dragon Mask, Rezmir can take up to three legendary actions between each of her turns, taking the actions all at once or spreading them over the round. A legendary action can be taken only at the start or end of a turn.

legendary.name: Darkness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends from a point Rezmir can see within 60 feet of her and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as Rezmir maintains concentration, up to 1 minute. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the area overlaps with a area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

legendary.name: Melee Attack
entries: Rezmir makes one melee attack.

legendary.name: Hide
entries: Rezmir takes the Hide action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Azbara is an 11th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Azbara has the following spells prepared from the wizard spell list:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Azbara has two {@item spell scroll (1st level)||scrolls} of {@spell mage armor}.

trait.name: Potent Cantrips
entries: When Azbara casts an evocation Cantrips and misses, or the target succeeds on its saving throw, the target still takes half the cantrip's damage but suffers no other effect.

trait.name: Sculpt Spells
entries: When Azbara casts an evocation spell that affects other creatures that he can see, he can choose a number of them equal to 1+the spell's level to succeed on their saving throws against the spell. Those creatures take no damage if they would normally take half damage from the spell.

trait.name: Empowered Evocation
entries: Azbara can add +5 (his Intelligence modifier) to the damage roll of any wizard evocation spell he casts. The damage bonus applies to one damage roll of a spell, not multiple rolls.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: On his turn, Langdedrosa can take one additional action.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: Langdedrosa's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Indomitable (1/day)
entries: Langdedrosa can reroll a saving throw that he fails, and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: Whenever Langdedrosa rolls a 1 or 2 on a damage die for a greatsword attack, he may reroll the die.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Langdedrosa makes three melee attacks, or two ranged ones.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Langdedrosa breathes lightning in a 45-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Lightning Smash
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 5d6}) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: While wielding a melee weapon, Langdedrosa can add +4 to his AC against a melee attack that would hit him.

monster.name: Penanggalan
languages: languages it knew in life (Common, Elvish, Celestial, Abyssal)

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The penanggalan's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each living creature within 60 feet of the penanggalan that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the penanggalan is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the penanggalan's horrifying visage for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Walk as the Living
entries: When the penanggalan's head reattaches to its body, it appears as it did in life and its alignment is perceived as neutral. Also, it is unaffected by spells or magic that target or detect undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The penanggalan makes two attacks, only one of which can be its bite.

action.name: Withering Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

The penanggalan regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be affected by a blood curse. A protection from evil and good or similar spell will prevent this curse. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@damage 3d6}) for every 24 hours that pass. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. If the target is a humanoid or giant and is buried without precautions, it will rise the following night as a ghoul under the penanggalan's control.

action.name: Entrails
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition paralyzed}, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Emptying a vial of holy water on the target also ends the effect on it.

action.name: Slumber Charm (1/Short Rest)
entries: The penanggalan targets one unconcious creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} for 10 minutes. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target remains {@condition unconscious}, even when damaged. The effect will end earlier if the sun rises or the penanggalan is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target or takes a bonus action to end the effect.
If the target succeeds on its save, it is immune to the penanggalan's charm ability until sunrise, but does not awaken and is unaware of the charm attempt.

entries.name: Penanggalan Weaknesses
entries: The penanggalan has the following flaws while separated from its body:

items: Reattach. After sunrise, if the penanggalan cannot reattach its head to its body, it takes 30 radiant damage every hour that passes.
Sunlight Paralysis. While in direct sunlight, the penanggalan is paralyzed.

Dense Vegetation. Moving through any difficult terrain created by vegetation is harmful to the penanaggalan. Every 5 feet it travels, it takes 5 (1d10) piercing and slashing damage. It also has disadvantage on any saving throw or ability check to avoid or escape the effects of the vegetation.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: On his turn, Othelstan can take one additional action.

trait.name: Tiamat's Blessing of Retribution
entries: When Othelstan takes damage that reduces him to 0 hit points, he immediately regains 20 hit points. If he has 20 hit points or fewer at the end of his next turn, he dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Othelstan attacks twice with his flail or spear, or makes two ranged attacks with his spears.

action.name: Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Drow Spellcasting
headerEntries: Exyra's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Exyra is a 5th level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks), and she has the following ranger spells prepared:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Exyra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Umbral Sight
entries: While in sunlight, Exyra has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight. However, while in darkness, she is {@condition invisible} to any creature that relies on darkvision to see her.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Exyra deals an extra 28 ({@damage 8d6}) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Exyra that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and she doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Exyra is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Exyra instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Dread Ambush Master
entries: Exyra has advantage on initiative checks and adds her Wisdom modifier to them, and any attacks against the first creature Exyra hits with an attack on the first round of a combat have advantage until the start of her next turn. During the first turn of a combat, her walk speed increases by 10 feet, and she may make an additional weapon attack as part of an Attack action. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d8}) damage of the weapon's damage type.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When using the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost Exyra extra movement on that turn. When she makes a melee attack against a creature, Exyra doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether she hits or not.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Exyra makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Scimitar (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) slashing damage, plus 28 ({@damage 8d6}) damage.

action.name: Shortbow (+1)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) piercing damage, plus 28 ({@damage 8d6}) damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Exyra takes the Dash, Disengage or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Exyra halves the damage she takes from any single attack.

reaction.name: Skirmisher
entries: Exyra moves up to half her speed (25 ft.) without provoking opportunity attacks when an enemy ends their turn within 5 ft. of her.

spellcasting.name: Druidic Spellcasting
headerEntries: Virtumal is an 11th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, +13 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following druid spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Staff Spellcasting
headerEntries: Virtumal can cast the following spells using his {@item staff of the woodlands}, using a set number of charges:

trait.name: Equipment
entries: Virtumal is wearing a {@item silver dragon scale mail} and is wielding a {@item staff of the woodlands}.

trait.name: Elemental Wild Shape (2/rest)
entries: As a bonus action, Virtumal can magically assume the shape of a beast that is {@filter of challenge rating 4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&4]|type=beast|miscellaneous=!swarm} for up to 5 hours, until his wild shape loses all of its hit points, or until he reverts to his true form as a bonus action.

Alternatively, Virtumal may expend both uses of this ability to assume the shape of an {@filter elemental of challenge rating 5 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&5]|type=elemental|miscellaneous=!swarm} instead.

action.name: Staff of the Woodlands
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Staff of the Woodlands (Shillelagh)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Primal Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Relentless Hunt (1/Turn)
entries: If Kagaan takes 34 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, he is reduced to 1 hit point instead, and can immediately move up to his walking speed towards a hostile creature he can see.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: Kagaan the Green can perfectly recall any path he has traveled.

trait.name: Faultless Tracker
entries: Kagaan the Green can choose a creature within 120 feet as a quarry. Kagaan knows the direction to his quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. He may only have one quarry at a time, and cannot choose a new quarry until the last one was killed or captured.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If Kagaan moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with his gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Noxious Rage (4/day)
entries: As a bonus action, Kagaan can empower himself with toxic energy. For up to 1 minute, or until he is {@condition incapacitated} or dies, Kagaan has advantage on all Strength checks and saving throws, deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage with his Jade Fangs, and gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. At the end of each of his turns, he takes 4 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage, which cannot be negated in any way.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kagaan makes three melee weapon attacks: one with his gore, and two with his Jade Fangs.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Jade Fang
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The einherjar’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Battle-Loving
entries: Einherjars relish in combat and thrive in it; they find it difficult to turn away from it. They have disadvantage on Charisma and Wisdom checks against attempts at intimidation, but will be enraged and engage the perpetrator rather than becoming {@condition frightened} if they fail. They also have disadvantage on saving throws against compelled duel, sanctuary and similar spells, but ignore the effects of the spell if they fail; they attack the caster of their own free will instead, and are not dissuaded by impossible odds or the caster's allies. Einherjar will invariably fight to the death, though they often choose to spare mortal opponents, and can be reasoned with to stop fighting. An einherjar who is persuaded not to fight will likely expect a rematch in the future, and may come to collect.

trait.name: Valhallan Glory
entries: While at or below 50 hit points, einherjar make all attacks with advantage, and regain 8 hit points at the start of their every turn. If reduced to 0 hit points outside of Ysgard, they are instantaneously transported to Valhalla, where they must rest for 7 days before resuming any activities. Otherwise, they die, and are resurrected in Valhalla at next dawn.

trait.name: Frenzied Gaze
entries: If the einherjar fails a check against an attempt at intimidation by a hostile creature, they may immediately move up to half their speed and make one attack against the creature as a reaction, and must continue attacking that creature until it falls to 0 hit points or combat ends.

trait.name: Equipment
entries: The einherjar carries two beautifully-made battleaxes, forged and sharpened in Ysgard, and two magical handaxes. The battleaxes are +2 weapons and deal an additional die of damage, and must be left behind if the einherjar falls in battle. They retain their enchantment for a tenday, unless a Valkyrie or any other Ysgardian that is not an einherjar renews the enchantment by touch.
The handaxes immediately return to the einherjar's belt upon hitting or missing when thrown, and also count as magical for the purposes of non-magical resistance or immunity.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The einherjar makes three attacks with their Ysgardian battleaxes (reduced to two if it loses one). They may replace up to two attacks with handaxe attacks.

action.name: Ysgardian Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage in melee, or 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage at range.

Stout, proud warriors with golden auras, the einherjar wear exquisite armor and carry magical weapons, and decorate their bodies with intricate tattoos and complicated hair cuts - it is said no two braid their beards and hair quite alike.

As the spirits of warriors chosen by the Valkyries and brought to Valhalla to fight for the gods, the einherjar are great warriors who eat and drink their fill of boar and mead each night, then spend their days preparing for Ragnarok. Some of this is combat training, and the rest is reckless slaughter, to try their strength against each oher. Regardless of how often they are slain, the einherjar reappear each morning in Odin’s hall, so they have no fear of death, and their courage shames others into greater bravery.

entries.name: Defenders of the Mortal World
entries: From time to time, the Valkyries or ravens guide a troop of einherjar against some of Loki’s minions or the servants of other gods. These raids are often small battles, but the einherjar know they are only delaying the inevitable rise of the World Serpent and its many evil spawn. This drives them to greater efforts against giants, demons, dragons, and other evil creatures, but the einherjar themselves are not exactly saintly. They drink, they carouse, they slap and tickle and brag and boast and fart as the loudest and most boisterous of Ysgardians. Unlike most extraplanar creatures, they are the soul of any party they stumble drunkenly into, even though they are somewhat larger than life.

entries.name: Fear Others
entries: The einherjar have a notable soft spot for mortals, as well as small animals such as cats and rodents, wolves and ravens, but they are superstitiously fearful of dark elves, giants and dragons of all kinds. This fear often takes on the guise of mindless rampage, and they seek to destroy what they cannot avoid. They stick to their beliefs with fierce tenacity and, though it is possible (and not too dangerous) to have them change their mind about other creatures and deities, it is extremely difficult. They sometimes hunt or ride or carouse with the fey lords and ladies, especially the Summer King and Queen, the Prince of Fools and the Lord of the Hunt.

entries.name: Defenders of the Mortal World
entries: From time to time, the Valkyries or ravens guide a troop of einherjar against some of Loki’s minions or the servants of other gods. These raids are often small battles, but the einherjar know they are only delaying the inevitable rise of the World Serpent and its many evil spawn. This drives them to greater efforts against giants, demons, dragons, and other evil creatures, but the einherjar themselves are not exactly saintly. They drink, they carouse, they slap and tickle and brag and boast and fart as the loudest and most boisterous of Ysgardians. Unlike most extraplanar creatures, they are the soul of any party they stumble drunkenly into, even though they are somewhat larger than life.

monster.name: Egg
senses: tremorsense 30 ft. (blind and deafened past this radius)

conditionImmune.preNote: all conditions other than invisible and petrified;
conditionImmune.note: any conditions are transferred to the creature inside when it hatches, if it is not immune to them.

trait.name: Telepathic Commander
entries: The overlord communicates what it sees through its senses to all Swarm creatures within 90 feet of it.
When all overlords in an area are killed or otherwise disconnected from their troops, said Swarm troops are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Ventral Sacs
entries: The overlord can transport up to 16 units of space inside itself. A small creature takes up 1 unit of space, a medium creature takes up 2 units of space, a large creature takes up 4 units of space, and a huge creature takes up 8 units of space. Two larvae can fit in one unit of space. If any creatures are inside of the overlord when it dies, they die. Two overlords can carry a single gargantuan creature.

action.name: Excrete Creep
entries: If the overlord has not moved since the start of its last turn, it can excrete creep from its orifices. Creep falls straight down from the overlord, covering all surfaces in a 20 foot radius from the point of contact with the creep. All Swarm creatures touching creep have their walking speed increased by 10 ft., and regenerate 2 hit points at the start of their turns if they have at least 1 hit point left. This creep dies and dissolves at the end of the overlords next turn if it does not continue excreting it as an action and no creep tumors are implanted to maintain it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The einherjar’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Battle-Loving
entries: Einherjars relish in combat and thrive in it; they find it difficult to turn away from it. They have disadvantage on Charisma and Wisdom checks against attempts at intimidation, but will be enraged and engage the perpetrator rather than becoming {@condition frightened} if they fail. They also have disadvantage on saving throws against compelled duel, sanctuary and similar spells, but ignore the effects of the spell if they fail; they attack the caster of their own free will instead, and are not dissuaded by impossible odds or the caster's allies. Einherjar will invariably fight to the death, though they often choose to spare mortal opponents, and can be reasoned with to stop fighting. An einherjar who is persuaded not to fight will likely expect a rematch in the future, and may come to collect.

trait.name: Valhallan Glory
entries: While at or below 35 hit points, einherjar make all attacks with advantage, and regain 8 hit points at the start of their every turn. If reduced to 0 hit points outside of Ysgard, they are instantaneously transported to Valhalla, where they must rest for 7 days before resuming any activities. Otherwise, they die, and are resurrected in Valhalla at next dawn.

trait.name: Equipment
entries: The einherjar carries one beautifully-made battleaxe and a suit of plate armor, both forged in Ysgard, and a magical javelin. The battleaxe is a +2 weapon which deals an additional die of damage, while the suit of armor is a +1 plate armor; both must be left behind if the einherjar falls in battle. They retain their enchantment for a tenday, unless a Valkyrie or any other Ysgardian that is not an einherjar renews the enchantment by touch.
The javelin immediately returns to the einherjar's quiver upon hitting or missing when thrown, and also counts as magical for the purposes of non-magical resistance or immunity.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The einherjar makes two attacks with their Ysgardian battleaxe or javelin.

action.name: Ysgardian Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage in melee, or 8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage at range.

Stout, proud warriors with golden auras, the einherjar wear exquisite armor and carry magical weapons, and decorate their bodies with intricate tattoos and complicated hair cuts - it is said no two braid their beards and hair quite alike.

As the spirits of warriors chosen by the Valkyries and brought to Valhalla to fight for the gods, the einherjar are great warriors who eat and drink their fill of boar and mead each night, then spend their days preparing for Ragnarok. Some of this is combat training, and the rest is reckless slaughter, to try their strength against each oher. Regardless of how often they are slain, the einherjar reappear each morning in Odin’s hall, so they have no fear of death, and their courage shames others into greater bravery.

entries.name: Defenders of the Mortal World
entries: From time to time, the Valkyries or ravens guide a troop of einherjar against some of Loki’s minions or the servants of other gods. These raids are often small battles, but the einherjar know they are only delaying the inevitable rise of the World Serpent and its many evil spawn. This drives them to greater efforts against giants, demons, dragons, and other evil creatures, but the einherjar themselves are not exactly saintly. They drink, they carouse, they slap and tickle and brag and boast and fart as the loudest and most boisterous of Ysgardians. Unlike most extraplanar creatures, they are the soul of any party they stumble drunkenly into, even though they are somewhat larger than life.

entries.name: Fear Others
entries: The einherjar have a notable soft spot for mortals, as well as small animals such as cats and rodents, wolves and ravens, but they are superstitiously fearful of dark elves, giants and dragons of all kinds. This fear often takes on the guise of mindless rampage, and they seek to destroy what they cannot avoid. They stick to their beliefs with fierce tenacity and, though it is possible (and not too dangerous) to have them change their mind about other creatures and deities, it is extremely difficult. They sometimes hunt or ride or carouse with the fey lords and ladies, especially the Summer King and Queen, the Prince of Fools and the Lord of the Hunt.

monster.name: Valkyrie

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Valkyrie’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Aurora Borealis
entries: The Valkyrie is enveloped in Northern Lights, which shine bright light in 15 ft. and dim light in 15 ft. past that. This light counts as daylight, and cannot be dispelled or smothered by magical darkness, but is suppressed in an antimagic field.
Additionally, the light seeps into any wounds the Valkyrie inflicts, causing all her weapon attacks to become magical and deal an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Cloak of Doom
entries: Any creature that is not undead or a construct and starts its turn within 60 feet of the Valkyrie is overcome by her unsettling presence, and must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, unless the Valkyrie is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. If a creature's saving throw is successful or its condition ends, the creature is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours. The Valkyrie can suppress this effect at will.

trait.name: Gift of Tongues
entries: Valkyries become fluent in any language they hear spoken for at least 1 minute, and they retain this knowledge forever.

trait.name: Winged Stallion
entries: The Valkyrie rides its greater steed, a bonded {@creature Pegasus}, which is wearing {@item half plate barding}. While mounted, she can use the Pegasus' flying and walking speed, but she loses the ability to use the Gungnirean Lance for melee attacks if dismounted. She is dismounted if the mount drops to 0 hit points, is knocked {@condition prone} or otherwise separated from the Valkyrie. If the Valkyrie drops to 0 hit points and her Pegasus is not {@condition incapacitated}, it attempts to place her on itself as an action and flies away. If the Pegasus is above the clouds, it may cast Plane Shift on itself and the Valkyrie, returning to Ysgard.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Valkyrie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Valkyrie makes one attack with her Gungnirean Lance, and one with her Ravenwine Longsword if she has one drawn. Alternatively, she can make two attacks with her Ravenwine Longswords.

action.name: Gungnirean Lance
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. Additionally, the target is enveloped in Boreal light, and the next attack against them has advantage, as if affected by the Guiding Bolt spell.

action.name: Ravenwine Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

If the Valkyrie hits a creature with two Ravenwine Longsword attacks before the start of her next turn, she saps the creature's "ravenwine", dealing an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and regaining the same amount of hit points.

legendaryHeader: The Valkyrie can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Valkyrie regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell
entries: The Valkyrie casts a non-damaging spell or a cantrip.

legendary.name: Lance or Longsword Attack
entries: The Valkyrie makes one Gungnirean Lance or Ravenwine Longsword attack.

legendary.name: Fimbulwinter (1/Week, Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Valkyrie blows into a goat's horn, causing a snowstorm to cover the area within a 30-ft. radius of her, making it lightly obscured to every other creature. The snowstorm lasts until the end of her next turn, upon which two {@creature Winter Wolf||winter wolves} appear within the area where the snowstorm was.

They drink, they carouse, they slap and tickle and brag and boast and fart as the loudest and most boisterous of Ysgardians. Unlike most extraplanar creatures, they are the soul of any party they stumble drunkenly into, even though they are somewhat larger than life.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The einherjar is a 16th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The einherjar can cast the following bard spells, without any material components:

spells: {@spell geas} (can be cast as an action)
{@spell scrying} (can show the vision to nearby creatures as it occurs)
{@spell Mordenkainen's sword} (appears as a shining axe of Forseti)

trait.name: Battle-Loving
entries: Einherjars relish in combat and thrive in it; they find it difficult to turn away from it. They have disadvantage on Charisma and Wisdom checks against attempts at intimidation, but will be enraged and engage the perpetrator rather than becoming {@condition frightened} if they fail. They also have disadvantage on saving throws against compelled duel, sanctuary and similar spells, but ignore the effects of the spell if they fail; they attack the caster of their own free will instead, and are not dissuaded by impossible odds or the caster's allies. Einherjar will invariably fight to the death, though they often choose to spare mortal opponents, and can be reasoned with to stop fighting. An einherjar who is persuaded not to fight will likely expect a rematch in the future, and may come to collect.

trait.name: Valhallan Glory
entries: While at or below 35 hit points, einherjar make all attacks with advantage, and regain 8 hit points at the start of their every turn. If reduced to 0 hit points outside of Ysgard, they are instantaneously transported to Valhalla, where they must rest for 7 days before resuming any activities. Otherwise, they die, and are resurrected in Valhalla at next dawn.

trait.name: Equipment
entries: The einherjar carries two beautifully-made handaxes, forged and sharpened in Ysgard. The handaxes are +1 weapons that deal an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder or psychic damage (einherjar's choice). They immediately return to the einherjar's belt upon hitting or missing when thrown, and must be left behind if the einherjar falls in battle. They retain their enchantment for a tenday, unless a Valkyrie or any other Ysgardian that is not an einherjar renews the enchantment by touch.

trait.name: Way of the Ancient Words
entries: The einherjar is a master of Skaldic verse, which they combine with Ysgardian magic to weave the fate and tales of their enemies and allies alike. Up to six times per day, the einherjar may use the Thread of the Norns reaction or the Bragi's Touch bonus action. The einherjar can benefit from these abilities instead of choosing another allied creature.

trait.name: Forseti's Judgment
entries: The einherjar may make a weapon attack as a bonus action if they have used an action to cast a spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The einherjar makes two attacks with their Ysgardian handaxes.

action.name: Ysgardian Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage in melee, or 9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage at range, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic or thunder damage.

bonus.name: Bragi's Touch
entries: The einherjar chooses a willing creature within 60 feet who can hear them. For the next minute, the creature may add a {@dice d10} to one ability check, saving throw or attack or damage roll. Alternatively, the creature may use its reaction to add a {@dice d10} to its AC for one attack roll made against it.

reaction.name: Thread of the Norns
entries: The einherjar casts the spell {@spell silvery barbs}.
